definitions.definition: the thick white or pale yellow fatty liquid that rises to the top of milk, used in cooking or as a type of sauce to put on fruit, etc.

examples.text: We had strawberries and cream for dessert.
**whipped cream**
a dollop of fresh cream
scones with cream and jam
I asked for two coffees with cream.
Would you like milk or cream in your coffee?
cream cakes *(= containing cream)*
She piled great dollops of cream onto her apple pie.
This cream's gone off!
Whisk the cream and icing sugar together.

definitions.definition: a sweet that has a soft substance like cream inside

examples.text: a chocolate/peppermint cream

definitions.definition: a soft substance or thick liquid used on your skin to protect it or make it feel soft; a similar substance used for cleaning things

examples.text: moisturizing cream
Put a little antiseptic cream on the grazed skin.
a topical antibiotic cream
anti-wrinkle/anti-ageing cream
a cream cleaner

definitions.definition: a pale colour between yellow and white

examples.text: Do you have this blouse in cream?
an eye-catching outfit of cream and black
a warm yellow shade of cream

definitions.definition: the best people or things in a particular group

examples.text: the cream of New York society
**the cream of the crop** of this season’s movies
She looked like a cat that’s got the cream. She was almost purring with pleasure.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French cresme, from a blend of late Latin cramum (probably of Gaulish origin) and ecclesiastical Latin chrisma, from Greek khrisma ‘anointing’, from khriein ‘anoint’.
